articles.author: Shruti Wilson
articles.title: African countries to receive six million Johnson and Johnson vaccines, the African Union says - News Track English
articles.description: Around six million doses of the single-shot Johnson & Johnson coronavirus vaccine will be delivered by the African Union to 27 African nations that have paid for the shipments through the end of August. AU coronavirus envoy Strive Masiyiwa said 18 countries a…

articles.author: Lynn Butler
articles.title: SA rowers have disappointing start but progress to repechage in Tokyo - News24
articles.description: South Africa's rowers had a disappointing start to their Olympic campaign as they finished last in both the men's pair and men's fours heats.
articles.content:
South Africa's rowers had a disappointing start to their Olympic campaign as they finished last in both the men's pair and men's fours heats.
Rowing has become one of South Africa's most successful … [+1148 chars]

articles.title: Warren Gatland's 'dented ego' jibe mocked by Springboks as tempers flare before first British and Irish Lions test - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: South Africa vow to do their talking on the pitch after the Lions' Kiwi coach claimed his side had gained the upper hand in the set-piece battle.
articles.content:
The Springboks promised to settle their war of words with the Lions on the pitch in Saturday's first test as they mocked British and Irish Lions boss Warren Gatlands dented ego jibe.

articles.author: Jan Gerber
articles.title: IEC to approach courts to postpone October's municipal elections - News24
articles.description: The Electoral Commission of South Africa will urgently approach an appropriate court with an application to postpone the local government elections, which was initially scheduled for 27 October.
articles.content:
• The IEC will approach the courts to postpone the local government elections.

articles.author: sport
articles.title: South Africa's Olympic football coach slams Covid 'stigmatisation' - News24
articles.description: South Africa's Olympic football coach, David Notoane hit out at "stigmatisation" of his Covid-hit squad, after they were forced to isolate before their 1-0 defeat to Japan.
articles.content:
South Africa's Olympic football coach hit out at "stigmatisation" of his Covid-hit squad, after they were forced to isolate before their 1-0 defeat to Japan on Thursday.
